newsitem.title: USA: Three workers slain in Tenn. fast-food restaurant.
newsitem.headline: Three workers slain in Tenn. fast-food restaurant.

text.p: Three employees of a McDonald's restaurant died from shotgun blasts and a fourth was in critical condition with stab wounds suffered during an apparent robbery, police said Monday.
Police said two victims were found dead from shotgun wounds inside the entrance to the restaurant, and a third died later Monday at a hospital from head wounds.
Police were searching for a two-door Buick Regal spotted fleeing the scene.

One of the workers was found next to a telephone, apparently after dialing police and then collapsing. The murders likely occurred after the restaurant closed late Sunday and the employees were cleaning up, police said.

Police did not say how much money was thought to be missing, or whether there might be any connection to a similar robbery of another Nashville fast-food restaurant about a month ago in which two employees were killed.
